intro: Gyrostachys ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf gyrostachys, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ovate, leathery leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in spherical inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Gyrostachys ovalifolia is typically found in shrubland and woodland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
